name: 1. Commitment to negotiate a “permanent and comprehensive UK-wide customs union with the EU” in any Brexit deal
2. Require a public vote to confirm any Brexit deal passed by parliament before its ratification
3. Labour's plan for a close economic relationship with the EU
4. UK membership of the European Free Trade Association (Efta) and European Economic Area (EEA)
5. Revoke article 50 two days before Britain would leave the EU without a deal
6. Leave the EU without a deal on 12 April
7. Calls for the government to seek to agree preferential trade arrangements with the EU
8. Remain within the EEA and rejoin Efta but outside a customs union with the EU
